message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to each of these 10 statements about AI in education. As a Swedish teacher, I should provide thoughtful responses that reflect realistic perspectives on both the benefits and risks of AI in educational settings.

Let me think through each statement:

TT4G35A - Helps with lesson planning: This is generally true. AI can assist with brainstorming, structuring content, etc. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35B - Adapts material to different abilities: This is a real capability of AI. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35C - Assists with individual student support: Yes, AI can provide personalized learning paths. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35D - Supports students with specific needs: AI can help with translation, text-to-speech, etc. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35E - Automates administrative tasks: Yes, grading, attendance, etc. can be automated. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35F - Enables plagiarism/misrepresentation: This is a real concern. I'd say "Agree" because it does enable this

TT4G35G - Makes inappropriate/incorrect recommendations: Yes, AI can make mistakes or give poor advice. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35H - Amplifies biases: This is a documented concern with AI systems. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35I - Jeopardises privacy/security: This is a legitimate concern about data handling. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35J - Suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches: This is possible, depends on AI training. I'd say "Agree" or "Disagree"... I think this is more speculative. I'll say "Disagree" as I don't think this is necessarily a primary concern.

Actually, let me reconsider TT4G35J - if AI doesn't have good training data on pedagogy, it might suggest things that aren't pedagogically sound. 

I'll change this to "Agree" to acknowledge this risk. Now I'll construct the JSON array with all responses.
